page.title: 13BLAIRS COLLEGE HISTORY
page.content: From{1716}Roman Catholic boys studied for the{priesthood}at Scalan in Glenlivet and Aquhorties near Inverurie. In time these colleges became too small and John Menzies,the last{Laird of Pitfodels,}gave his {mansion at Blairs}to the Catholic Church in{1827 as a seminary. By 1897 this building became too small for the growing number of students and so a new building was erected. As well as having a fine{neo-Gothic {Church}there is also a{museum}and small{art gallery with many relics of {the Stuart family,}including a well known portrait of{Mary Queen of Scots. The library had a fine collection of {books and manuscripts}until 1974 when it was lent to the National Library in Edinburgh.
